position: Head of the European and International Affairs Department
relevant_communication:
-    Founding member of the Alliance for MRI in response to the proposed revision of the Directive on protecting workers from electromagnetic fields (EMF Directive) including events at European Parliament in Brussels and Strasbourg 
-    Contributions to non-binding guide to good practice (EMF guide) in addition to the Directive on protecting workers from electromagnetic fields (EMF Directive) – formation of the ‘MR safety working group’ 
-    ESR Call for a European Action Plan for Medical Imaging to improve patient safety and quality of care (launch event held at European Parliament in Brussels)  
-    EuroSafe Imaging Campaign to support and strengthen medical radiation protection in Europe following a holistic, inclusive approach 
-    ESR Patient Advisory Group to bring together patients, the public and imaging professionals in order to positively influence advances in the field of medical imaging to the benefit of European patients 
-    Summary of the European Directive 2013/59/Euratom: essentials for health professionals in radiology 
- Summary of GDPR for radiologists 
- ESR concept paper on Value-Based Radiology 
- Contributing to the BBMRI-ERIC Code of Conduct for Health Research in the context of implementing the GDPR
legal_status: European Society according to Austrian Law
goals__remit:
The European Society of Radiology is the European body representing the radiology profession with over 75,500 individual members worldwide and acts as the umbrella organisation of all national radiological societies in Europe as well as Europe’s subspecialty organisations in the field of radiology.  
The European Society of Radiology is an apolitical, non-profit organisation, dedicated to promoting and coordinating the scientific, philanthropic, intellectual and professional activities of radiology in all European countries. The Society's mission at all times is to serve the healthcare needs of the general public through the support of science, teaching, research and the quality of service in the field of radiology. 
For more information see: http://www.myesr.org
